column2: What does IAM stand for?
column3: Identity and Access Management

column2: What is the main purpose of IAM?
column3: Ensure the right people have the right access at the right time

column2: What is authentication?
column3: Verifying the identity of a user or system

column2: What is authorization?
column3: Determining what an authenticated user is allowed to do

column2: Which of these is a factor in multi-factor authentication (MFA)?
column3: Something you know

column2: Which is an example of "something you are"?
column3: Fingerprint

column2: Why is MFA strongly recommended for privileged accounts?
column3: Reduces risk of account takeover

column2: What is a role-based access control (RBAC)?
column3: Assign permissions based on job roles

column2: Why is the principle of least privilege important in IAM?
column3: Limits damage if an account is compromised

column2: What is single sign-on (SSO)?
column3: Use one authentication to access multiple systems
column4: Use many passwords for one system

column2: Why is account provisioning important?
column3: Ensures users get necessary access when they join

column2: What is deprovisioning?
column3: Removing access when users leave or change roles

column2: Why is timely deprovisioning critical?
column3: Reduces risk from orphaned accounts

column2: What is an identity provider (IdP)?
column3: System that authenticates users and issues identity tokens

column2: Which protocol is commonly used for federated identity SSO?
column3: SAML

column2: Why are shared user accounts discouraged?
column3: Difficult to attribute actions to individuals

column2: What is password complexity policy?
column3: Rules that define the strength requirements for passwords

column2: Why should default passwords be changed?
column3: They are widely known and often published

column2: What is account lockout policy used for?
column3: Thwart brute-force login attempts

column2: Why should admin accounts be separate from normal user accounts?
column3: Reduces risk when users browse and read email

column2: What is privilege creep?
column3: Accumulation of access rights over time

column2: How can privilege creep be reduced?
column3: Regular access reviews and role adjustments

column2: What is an access review or certification?
column3: Periodic check of who has what access

column2: Why is identity lifecycle management important?
column3: Controls access from joiner to leaver

column2: What is "just-in-time" (JIT) access?
column3: Temporary elevated access granted only when needed

column2: Why is logging of authentication and authorization events important?
column3: Support investigations and detect anomalies

column2: What is a service account?
column3: Account used by applications or services

column2: Why must service accounts be protected carefully?
column3: They may have high privileged access

column2: What is "credential stuffing"?
column3: Using stolen passwords from one site to try others

column2: Which measure helps prevent credential stuffing?
column3: MFA and rate limiting

column2: Why should admins avoid logging in interactively with highly privileged accounts?
column3: Increases risk of compromise on daily usage

column2: What is "identity federation"?
column3: Trusting external IdPs to authenticate users

column2: Why is strong identity proofing important when issuing credentials?
column3: Ensure accounts belong to the correct individuals

column2: What is least privilege for service accounts?
column3: Give only permissions needed for the service

column2: What does "step-up authentication" mean?
column3: Requiring stronger auth for sensitive actions

column2: Why should access to IAM admin console be tightly controlled?
column3: It can change access for the whole environment

column2: What is "identity store"?
column3: Database of user identities and attributes

column2: Why should password reuse across systems be avoided?
column3: Compromise of one system can impact others

column2: What is "role mining"?
column3: Analyzing permissions to design proper roles

column2: Why is fine-grained authorization beneficial?
column3: Allows precise control of who can do what

column2: What is adaptive authentication?
column3: Adjusting auth requirements based on risk factors

column2: Why should privileged sessions be monitored?
column3: Detect misuse or suspicious admin actions

column2: What is a "break-glass" account?
column3: Emergency admin account with strict controls

column2: Why must break-glass accounts be tightly controlled and monitored?
column3: They hold high power for emergencies

column2: What does "SSO" primarily improve?
column3: User experience and central auth

column2: Why should identity data be protected like other sensitive data?
column3: Compromise can lead to impersonation
